name: Buffalo Wings in Dip Form
description: There's always a divide between what I want to bring to a party as an appetizer or side dish, and what's portable or easy to reheat. And for all those times I've tried making Buffalo wings in the cramped kitchen at other people's parties, there was a great alternative lurking the entire time. And that was Buffalo Chicken Dip.
recipeYield: Makes about 1 quart, serving 6 to 10 as an hors d'oeuvre
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup hot sauce, such as Frank's

recipeInstructions.text: Adjust oven rack to center position and preheat oven to 350°. In a bowl, combine cream cheese, salad dressing, and hot sauce. Whisk until smooth. Fold in blue cheese and chicken.

Transfer to a heatproof serving dish such as a ceramic soufflé dish or an enameled cast iron skillet and bake until mixture is heated through and starting to bubble, about 20 minutes. Stir well. Alternatively, heat mixture in a small crock pot or fondue pot until heated through.
